data.title: Hills and Rivers
data.statement:
You are really hungry and a long way from home and need to get home for dinner but unfortunately you are all alone and don't have a car so you have to traverse a lot of [[terrain]] to get there.

The [[terrain]] you have to traverse consists of {{flat land, hills, rivers}}.

The [[actions]] you can take to traverse the [[terrain]] include {{walk, climb, swim}}.

The [[terrain]] string illustrates flat land as {{_}}. When you encounter {{_}} you have to print the [[action]] {{walk}} to standard output.

The [[terrain]] string illustrates a hill as {{/\}}. When you encounter a {{/\}} you have to print the [[action]] {{climb}} to standard output.

The [[terrain]] string illustrates a river as {{....}}. When you encounter a {{....}} you have to print the [[action]] {{swim}} to standard output.

Where a character is repeated consecutively, that terrain feature should be regarded as a single feature, e.g. {{___}} or {{_______}} is a single piece of flat land and {{.....}} or {{.........}} is a single river. Hence, only one action is required. In contrast, each {{/\}} is a single hill and several hills may appear one after another, requiring multiple {{climb}} actions.

An example is shown below:
{{Input}}
You_________/\/\______.../\........._____/\......._________Home

{{Output}}
walk climb climb walk swim climb swim walk climb swim walk

testCases.title: A Journey Home
testCases.testOut: walk swim walk climb walk swim climb walk

testCases.title: Validator: A Journey Home
testCases.testOut: walk swim walk swim walk swim climb walk

testCases.title: Home Is Where The Heart Is
testCases.testOut: walk swim walk climb walk swim climb swim walk climb swim walk

testCases.title: Validator: Home Is Where The Heart Is
testCases.testOut: walk swim walk climb walk swim climb swim walk climb swim walk

testCases.title: Miles Away From Home
testCases.testOut: climb swim walk swim walk climb climb climb swim climb swim walk swim climb swim walk climb swim walk swim

testCases.title: Validator: Miles Away From Home
testCases.testOut: climb swim walk swim walk climb climb swim climb swim walk swim climb swim walk climb swim walk swim

data.constraints:
The input string [[terrain]] always starts with the word {{You}} and ends with the word {{Home}}.
The input string [[terrain]] only contains the characters {{Y o u H m e _ . / \}}
The input string [[terrain]] does not contain spaces.
3 ≤ number of consecutive {{_}} ≤ 10
3 ≤ number of consecutive {{.}} ≤ 10
data.inputDescription: <<Line 1:>> A string [[terrain]] beginning with the word {{You}}, then illustrating flat land {{_}}, hills {{/\}}, and rivers {{....}}, and ending with the word {{Home}}.
data.outputDescription: <<Line 1 :>> A string of single space separated [[actions]] {{walk climb swim}} you need to take to traverse the [[terrain]].

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

You are really hungry and a long way from home and need to get home for dinner but unfortunately you are all alone and don't have a car so you have to traverse a lot of terrain to get there.

The terrain you have to traverse consists of flat land, hills, rivers.

The actions you can take to traverse the terrain include walk, climb, swim.

The terrain string illustrates flat land as _. When you encounter _ you have to print the action walk to standard output.

The terrain string illustrates a hill as /\. When you encounter a /\ you have to print the action climb to standard output.

The terrain string illustrates a river as ..... When you encounter a .... you have to print the action swim to standard output.

Where a character is repeated consecutively, that terrain feature should be regarded as a single feature, e.g. ___ or _______ is a single piece of flat land and ..... or ......... is a single river. Hence, only one action is required. In contrast, each /\ is a single hill and several hills may appear one after another, requiring multiple climb actions.

An example is shown below:
Input
You_________/\/\______.../\........._____/\......._________Home

Output
walk climb climb walk swim climb swim walk climb swim walk
Input
Line 1: A string terrain beginning with the word You, then illustrating flat land _, hills /\, and rivers ...., and ending with the word Home.
Output
Line 1 : A string of single space separated actions walk climb swim you need to take to traverse the terrain.
Constraints
The input string terrain always starts with the word You and ends with the word Home.
The input string terrain only contains the characters Y o u H m e _ . / \
The input string terrain does not contain spaces.
3 ≤ number of consecutive _ ≤ 10
3 ≤ number of consecutive . ≤ 10
Example
Input
You_______/\___Home
Output
walk climb walk
